Generation I.Red: Once it strikes, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Once it strikes, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.
Generation I.Yellow: It attacks in a stealthy manner, without warning. Its sharp fangs are used to bite and suck blood.
Generation I.Stadium: Bites its prey and feeds on the victim's energy. Its own blood type changes to that of its victim.

Generation II.Gold: However hard its victim's hide may be, it punctures with sharp fangs and gorges itself with blood.
Generation II.Silver: It can drink more than 10 ounces of blood at once. If it has too much, it gets heavy and flies clumsily.
Generation II.Crystal: When it plunges its fangs into its prey, it instantly draws and gulps down more than ten ounces of blood.
Generation II.Stadium 2: However hard its victim's hide may be, it punctures with sharp fangs and gorges itself with blood. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) It can drink more than 10 ounces of blood at once. If it has too much, it gets heavy and flies clumsily. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Golbat loves to drink the blood of living things. It is particularly active in the pitch black of night. This Pok é mon flits around in the night skies, seeking fresh blood.
Generation III.Sapphire: Golbat bites down on prey with its four fangs and drinks the victim's blood. It becomes active on inky dark moonless nights, flying around to attack people and Pok é mon .
Generation III.Emerald: Its fangs easily puncture even thick animal hide. It loves to feast on the blood of people and Pok é mon . It flits about in darkness and strikes from behind.
Generation III.FireRed: It clamps down on its prey with needle-sharp fangs and drains over 10 ounces of blood in one gulp.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Once it bites, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.

Generation IV.Diamond: It loves the blood of humans and Pokémon. It flies around at night in search of neck veins.
Generation IV.Pearl: Once it starts sucking blood, it does not stop until it is full. It flies at night in search of prey.
Generation IV.Platinum: Its sharp fangs puncture the toughest of hides and have small holes for greedily sucking blood.
Generation IV.HeartGold: However hard its victim's hide may be, it punctures with sharp fangs and gorges itself with blood.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It can drink more than 10 ounces of blood at once. If it has too much, it gets heavy and flies clumsily.

Generation V.Black: Its sharp fangs puncture the toughest of hides and have small holes for greedily sucking blood.
Generation V.White: Its sharp fangs puncture the toughest of hides and have small holes for greedily sucking blood.
Generation V.Black 2: Flitting around in the dead of night, it sinks its fangs into its prey and drains a nearly fatal amount of blood.
Generation V.White 2: Flitting around in the dead of night, it sinks its fangs into its prey and drains a nearly fatal amount of blood.

Generation VI.X: Once it bites, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.
Generation VI.Y: Once it starts sucking blood, it does not stop until it is full. It flies at night in search of prey.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Golbat loves to drink the blood of living things. It is particularly active in the pitch black of night. This Pokémon flits around in the night skies, seeking fresh blood.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Golbat bites down on prey with its four fangs and drinks the victim's blood. It becomes active on inky dark moonless nights, flying around to attack people and Pokémon.

Generation VII.Sun: Its thick fangs are hollow like straws, making them unexpectedly fragile. These fangs are specialized for sucking blood.
Generation VII.Moon: Sometimes they drink so much blood, they can't fly anymore. Then they fall to the ground and become food for other Pokémon.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Every once in a while, you'll see a Golbat that's missing some fangs. This happens when hunger drives it to try biting a Steel-type Pokémon.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: They can suck down over 10 ounces of blood in one go. They have been known to drink so much blood that they can no longer fly.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: It attacks in a stealthy manner, without warning. Its sharp fangs are used to bite and to suck blood.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: It attacks in a stealthy manner, without warning. Its sharp fangs are used to bite and to suck blood.

Generation VIII.Sword: It loves to drink other creatures' blood. It's said that if it finds others of its kind going hungry, it sometimes shares the blood it's gathered.
Generation VIII.Shield: Its feet are tiny, but this Pokémon walks skillfully. It sneaks up on sleeping prey before sinking in its fangs and slurping up blood.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It loves the blood of humans and Pokémon. It flies around at night in search of neck veins.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Once it starts sucking blood, it does not stop until it is full. It flies at night in search of prey.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: It sinks its sharp fangs into other creatures and slurps up their blood. A closer look at the fangs reveals that they are hollow and akin to straws.
